page.title: 03The People
page.content: Originally the majority of the people worked on farms but since the advent of mechanization etc.there are no longer many farm workers, most of the work being done by the farmers themselves and their families. Consequently the population fell but quite a number of city workers decided that they would like to live in the country and to assist them the Carlisle City Council decided to make Smithfield into a development area.Stage 1 of this plan has just been completed in 1985 with the building of just over 30 houses and bungalows on Ryehill Park Estate in Smithfield.Quite a number of other city workers have bought country properties in the villages of Hethersgill, Scaleby and Scaleby Hill this has tended to restore and increase the local population.
